tutorial.intro1: Let me introduce you to SCER-League, the fantasy game dedicated to the Spanish Rally Championship.
tutorial.intro2: In this explanation, I will teach you how to play and progress until you master this discipline.
tutorial.functioningText1: The basic functionality of the application is simple: you have a team — the one you consider best — and based on that team and its real-life performance in each rally, you will earn points for every completed rally.
tutorial.functioningText2: To earn more money and build a better team, you must profit from buying and selling items.
tutorial.teamText1: In this section, you can see your team, which starts empty with a budget of €500,000.00. With this amount, you must hire drivers, co-drivers, and cars to form the team you want.
tutorial.teamText2: You can only have a maximum of 2 drivers, 2 co-drivers, and 1 car, so choose your team wisely.
tutorial.teamText3: You can also view and edit your team name, and check the points earned in completed rallies.
tutorial.marketText1: Here you can view and buy all drivers, co-drivers, and cars. Each has an individual price based on their performance throughout the season.
tutorial.marketText2: Remember you have a budget you must not exceed.
tutorial.marketText3: When you select an item, you’ll have the option to buy it or view its performance history.
tutorial.leaguesText1: In the leagues section, you can see your ranking in the general and private leagues. The general league is global, while private ones contain only invited users.
tutorial.leaguesText2: Standard users can only join one league, while VIP users can create and join an additional one.
tutorial.leaguesText3: To join a private league, you need the code provided by its creator.
tutorial.profileText1: In the profile section, you’ll see your information: email, username, user role, and team name.
tutorial.profileText2: You can change your team name, report bugs, and become a VIP user or administrator (with a password).
tutorial.profileText3: Administrators can manage bugs reported by other users.
